reviews.review_text: Simple as gameplay. You move your character left and right with the arrow keys, stand in a shadow and catch the hat (or fridge) on your head. Eventually you'll find minigames in between levels that change the game up a bit, stockpile hats that you can use to spend on 'skins' for characters and acquire gifts like a swear jar that throws obscenities at your face everytime you catch a hat.  Like I said, simple as. Its got some replayability.  7/10 its aight.

Just...where do I begin with this game? First of all, this game has graphics so superior that I'm surprised my rig could even handle it. And then the story? GAH! I thought I loved BioShock's story, but...wow. Just...wow. I was not expecting such a marvelous story from this game. The part where Jake Starbone realizes the true whereabouts of Princess Hamflute - WOW! - never before have I seen such characterization in a video game character. It was like he was truly a human being standing in front of me! Wow. Just...wow. Though, I must admit this rather shyly, I do still think my favorite part was when that local ponce - oh, what a charming fellow, lost his hat. . . . Oh, and the time I got squashed by a flying car and jumped backward a good half foot.
